thread.title: Barmaid compares Tinder dater to a croissant
thread.title_full: Barmaid compares Tinder dater to a croissant | Daily Mail Online

author: Alex Matthews For Mailonline
title: Barmaid compares Tinder dater to a croissant
text:
Katie Mccarthy, 27, from Stockton-on-Tees in Durham, was less than impressed with fellow daters on Tinder after being inundated by explicit pictures
A barmaid searching for a Valentine's Day date was left so disappointed by the bachelors on Tinder she compared one dater to a croissant.
Katie Mccarthy, 27, from Stockton-on-Tees in Durham, was less than impressed with the men on the dating app after being inundated by explicit pictures.
However, she left friends in hysterics after sharing a picture of one muscly Tinder bachelor and compared him to a French pastry.
She said: 'I had only had it about four days and that was my first time of using it.
'Everyone on there was ridiculous. I was left thinking 'What am I doing on here?'. There were such strange people.
'I'm not being awful but he looked like a pastry.
'There were all sorts of odd people on there, with odd interests.
'Online dating is not something I would normally do. But I was bored and thought it would be a laugh.
'I'd only been on there an hour or two when I came across this guy.
'It was his main photo. My first impression when I saw it was a croissant - that's what popped into my head. I couldn't stop laughing.
'To be fair, he looks quite good in some of his other pictures on the site, but for some reason he has chosen this daft one as his main photo.
'He wasn't my type and everyone has their own tastes to be fair but that wasn't a good photo to use in my opinion.
Pictured: Ms Mccarthy's hilarious post comparing one muscly dater to a croissant
'I find dating to be quite awkward really, especially after being with someone so long.
'With online dating, people just seem to want to send you a d*** pic straight away after talking for a minute. I've had that a million times. I've even had it from people I know.
'But it seems that's dating in this day and age. But that's not the way to my heart.
Ms Mccarthy (pictured) said that the bachelor looked 'quite good' in his other photos
'I don't like romance that much so I am hard to win over. But probably the way to my heart is with pizza.
'If there are any men thinking of getting in touch then pizza is probably the best option - certainly not a d*** pic.'
After taking a screenshot of the mystery man and positioning it next to an image of a croissant that looked strikingly similar, Katie shared it with friends.
She wrote on her post: 'IM F*
